original: “Puṇṇaṁ nadiṁ yena ca peyyamāhu,🔽Jātaṁ yavaṁ yena ca guyhamāhu;
analyzed: puṇṇam nadim yena ca peyyam āhu  jātam yavam yena ca guyham āhu
translated: “The river Punna, by which they say you drink,🔽The barley, by which they say you are full,
By which they say you are far gone,

original: So tyāgato handa ca bhuñja brāhmaṇa”.
analyzed: saḥ tya āgataḥ handa ca bhuñja brāhmaṇa
translated: You have been abandoned, so eat, brahmin.”

The Birth Story of the River Punna, the fourth.
